Post.title: nodepath.joinpath.resolve
Post._content:
<meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">

####  path.join([path1][, path2][, ...])
**`path.join()`**

path.join()stringstring
```javascript
// 
const path = require('path'); 
path.join('https://', 'www.', 'aaa', '.com', '/','aaa') 
'https://www.aaa.com/aaa' 

// 
path.join('aaa',{},'bbb') 
//  TypeError: Arguments to path.join must be strings'
```

#### path.resolve([from ...], to)
**path.resolve()**
cdresolve
```javascript
path.resolve('foo/bar', '/tmp/file/', '..', 'a/../truefile')
```

```javascript
cd foo/bar
cd /tmp/file/
cd ..
cd a/../truefile
pwd
```

```javascript
path.resolve('/foo/bar', './baz') 
//  '/foo/bar/baz' 
path.resolve('/foo/bar', '/tmp/file/') 
//  '/tmp/file' 

path.resolve(__dirname, 'static_files/png/', '../gif/image.gif') 
//  /home/itbilu/node 
// '/home/itbilu/node/wwwroot/static_files/gif/image.gif'

```

<meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">

## 
### 
```javascript
npm install --save-dev @babel/core @babel/cli @babel/preset-env 
```
### 

Babel 

+ #### 
`babel.config.json`/`babel.config.js`
+ jsjson

Babelbabel.config.json
+ #### 
`.babelrc.json`/`.babelrc.js`
+ jsjson
Babel`.babelrc.json``package.json`

## 
babel


```javascript
{
	preset: [
		"@babel/preset-env",
		{
			target: {
				edge: 17,
				firefox: 60,
				safari: 111
			}
		},
		{ useBuiltIns: "usage" },
	]
}
```
### 1. preset
+ **@babel/preset-env  ES2015+ **
+ **@babel/preset-typescript for TypeScript tsts-loader**
+ **@babel/preset-react for React**
#### preset
presets****
```javascript
{
  "presets": ["@babel/preset-env"]
}
```

### 2. target
`targets` 
+ ` android, chrome, deno, edge, electron, firefox, ie, ios, node, opera, rhino, safari, samsung`
+ `string`` > 0.5%`,` last 2 versions, not dead` 

### 3. useBuildIns
***useBuildInscorejs***
```javascript
npm i core-js -S
```

```javascript
{ useBuiltIns: "usage" },
```
+ `false` 
+ `usage`Babel targets polyfill 
+ entrypolyfill` import "core-js/stable"` 

### 4. corejs
corejs

####corejs?
babeles6`promise``async/await`corejs
`babel-polyfill`7.4

	],
	"comments": [
		{ "id": 1, "body": "some comment", "postId": 1 },
		{ "id": 2, "body": "some comment", "postId": 1 }
	],
	"profile": {
		"name": "typicode"
	}
}
```

Post._content:
<meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">

## AMD
### 

AMDrequirejs
### 
#### 1. 
AMDdefine

```javascript
define(id?: string,dependencies?: string[],factory: Function | object)
```

**`id`**: 

**`dependencies`**: `dependencies``["require", "exports", "module"]`

```javascript
define(function(require, exports, module) {}
```

**`factory`**: 

#### 2. 

`require`
```javascript
require([
	"moduleA",
	"moduleB",
	function (m1, m2) {
		// m1m2
	}
]);
```

#### 
`requirejs`

##### 1. 
![image.png](https://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/20892169-a1c46888e1da89da.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/1240)

##### 2. index.htmlrequirejsdata-main

```javascript
<script
	src="./require.js"
	data-main="js/main.js"></script>
```
##### 3. moduleAmoduleB
moduleA.js
```javascript
define(function () {
	function logStr(str) {
		console.log(str);
	}
	return { logStr };
// return
// define,require
});

```
moduleB.js
```javascript
define(["component/moduleA"], function (moduleA) {
// functionmoduleAfunction
// moduleA
	moduleA.logStr("moduleAmoduleB");
	function logNum(num) {
		console.log(num);
	}
	return { logNum };
});
```
main.js
```javascript
require(["component/moduleB"], function (moduleB) {
	console.log("ModuleBmain");
	moduleB.logNum(2);
});
```
require.config
```javascript
require.config({
	paths: {
		moduleB: "./component/moduleB"
	}
});
require(["moduleB"], function (moduleB) {
	console.log("ModuleBmain");
	moduleB.logNum(2);
});

```

Post.title: ES6
Post._content:
<meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">

## export
### 1. 

```javascript
export var firstName = 'Michael';
export var lastName = 'kaol';
export var age = '10'
```


```javascript
var firstName = 'Michael';
var lastName = 'kaol';
var age = '10'
export {firstName,lastName,age};
```

### 2. export

```javascript
export function fun() {
  return 'fun'
}  // fun
```

### 3. as

```javascript
function v1() { ... }
function v2() { ... }

export {
  v1 as streamV1,
  v2 as streamV2,
  v2 as streamLatestVersion
}
```
### 4. 

```javascript
var a = 1
export a // export 1
```
 
```javascript
export var a = 1
```
```javascript
var a = 1
export { a }
```
```javascript
var a = 1
export { a as n }
```
## import
importprofile.js

```javascript
import { firstName, lastName, year } from './profile.js';
```

## export default
### 1. 

```javascript
export default function () {
  console.log('foo');
}
```

``export default`` import

```javascript
function foo() {
  console.log('foo');
}

export default foo; 
```

foofoo
### 2. export default

```javascript
export default 1 //
```

```javascript
let a = 1
export default a //
```

```javascript
export default var a = 1 // export defaultdefault
```

export defaultimport

```javascript
let obj = {
  a: 1,
  b: 2,
  c: 3
}
export default obj
```


```javascript
import obj from 'xxx.js'
```

## 
### 1. commonJSimport
babelcommonJSrequireimportimportrequireimport
### 2. import


```javascript
export let a = 1;
export let b = 2;
export let c = 3;
```



```javascript
import {a,b,c} from xxx
```



```javascript
import * from xxx
```

### 3. import  export 
importexport
```javascript
export { a, b } from 'xxx_module';
// 
import { a, b } from 'my_module';
export { a, b };
```
## import()
import() Promise 
```javascript
const main = document.querySelector('main');

import(`./section-modules/${someVariable}.js`)
  .then(module => {
    module.loadPageInto(main);
  })
  .catch(err => {
    main.textContent = err.message;
  });
```
### import
#### 1. 
```javascript
if(flag) {
  import('./xxx')
}
```
#### 2. 
```javascript
btn.addEventListener('click',function(){
  import('./xxx')
})
```
#### 3. 
```javascript
function fun(a) {
  let moduleFun = ''
  if(a=1) {moduleFun = '/blog/1'}
  if(a=2) {moduleFun = '/blog/2'}
  if(a=3) {moduleFun = '/blog/3'}
  return moduleFun
}
import(fun(1)) // 
```

class C {
  static x = ...;

}

#### supersuper
###### 1. super
super****constructor()**super()**
```javascript
class Person {
    constructor (x,y) {
        this.x = x
        this.y = y
    }
}
class Student extends Person {
    constructor (x1,y1,newstring) {
        super(x1,y1)
        this.newstring = newstring
    }
}
let s1 = new Student(1,2,'str')
s1.x // 1
s1.newstring // str
```

###### 2. super
superPoint.prototype
supersuper
(prototype)supersuper
```javascript
class A {
  constructor() {
    this.p = 2;
  }
}

class B extends A {
  get m() {
    return super.p;
  }
}

let b = new B();
b.m // undefined
```
superthis****
```javascript
class A {
  constructor() {
    this.x = 1;
  }
  print() {
    console.log(this.x);
  }
}

class B extends A {
  constructor() {
    super();
    this.x = 2;
  }
  m() {
    super.print();
  }
}

let b = new B();
b.m() // 2
```
superthis
```javascript
class A {
  constructor() {
    this.x = 1;
  }
  static print() {
    console.log(this.x);
  }
}

class B extends A {
  constructor() {
    super();
    this.x = 2;
  }
  static m() {
    super.print();
  }
}

B.x = 3;
B.m() // 3
```

Post.title: Proxy
Post._content:
<meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">

## proxy
proxymonitor
```javascript
{
    let obj = {
        time: '2017-03-11',
        name: 'net',
        _r: 123
    }
```
### 1. proxy
#### 1handler
```javascript
        let proxy = new Proxy(obj,handler)
        handler = {
             get () {},
             set () {},
             has () {},
         }
```
#### 2
```javascript
	let proxy = new Proxy(obj,{
		get (target,key) {} // or get: function(target,key) {}
	})
```
## 2. get/set/has/
```javascript
    let monitor = new Proxy(obj,{
   //2. get
        get (target,key) {
            if(target[key].replace)
                return target[key].replace('2017','2018')
            else 
                return target[key]
            // return
        },
        set (target,key,value) {
    // 3. set
            if(key === 'name') {
                return target[key] == value
            }
        },
    // 4. hasin hasOwnProperty()
    // hasOwnProperty():keykey,
    // in: key in obj //obj key
        has (target,key) {
            if (key == '_r') {
                return false
            } else {
                return key in target
            }
        }
    // 5. construct() new
    // 6. deleteProperty() delete
    // 7. defineProperty() Object.defineProperty()
    // 8. ownKeys(target) Object.getOwnPropertyNames(proxy)Object.getOwnPropertySymbols(proxy)Object.keys(proxy)for...inObject.keys()
    // 9. apply(target, object, args) Proxy proxy(...args)proxy.call(object, ...args)proxy.apply(...)
    })

    console.log(monitor.time) // 2018-03-11
    monitor._r = 'sdffsfsdfds'
    console.log(monitor._r)
    monitor.name = 'sdffsfsdfds'
    console.log(monitor.name)
    console.log('name' in monitor) // true
    console.log('_r' in monitor) // false
    console.log('_r' in monitor) // false
}
```

  function _classCallCheck(instance, Constructor) { if (!(instance instanceof Constructor)) { throw new TypeError("Cannot call a class as a function"); } }

  function _defineProperties(target, props) { for (var i = 0; i < props.length; i++) { var descriptor = props[i]; descriptor.enumerable = descriptor.enumerable || false; descriptor.configurable = true; if ("value" in descriptor) descriptor.writable = true; Object.defineProperty(target, descriptor.key, descriptor); } }

  function _createClass(Constructor, protoProps, staticProps) { if (protoProps) _defineProperties(Constructor.prototype, protoProps); if (staticProps) _defineProperties(Constructor, staticProps); return Constructor; }

```

      const updateManager = wx.getUpdateManager();
      updateManager.onCheckForUpdate(function (res) {
        if (res.hasUpdate) { // 
          updateManager.onUpdateReady(function () {
            wx.showModal({
              title: '',
              content: '',
              success: function (res) {
                if (res.confirm) {//  applyUpdate 
                  updateManager.applyUpdate()
                }
              }
            })
          });
          updateManager.onUpdateFailed(function () {
            wx.showModal({// 
              title: '~',
              content: '~~',
            })
          })
        }
      })
    } else {
      wx.showModal({// 
        title: '',
        content: ''
      })
    }
  },

wx.request
```javascript
wx.request({
      url: _this.data.host + '/mobile/singleFeed?feedId=' + feedId,
      method: 'GET',
      header: {
        'Content-Type': 'application/json'
      },
      data: {
        orderPrice: _this.data.totalFee
      },
      success: function (res) {
        console.log(res);
        _this.setData({
          feedInfo: res.data.data
        })
      }
    })
```

wx.navigateTo({
  url: 'test?id=1',

    //

      console.log(data)

      console.log(data)
    }

})

    if (wx.canIUse('getUpdateManager')) {//
      const updateManager = wx.getUpdateManager();
      updateManager.onCheckForUpdate(function (res) {
        if (res.hasUpdate) { // 
          updateManager.onUpdateReady(function () {
            wx.showModal({
              title: '',
              content: '',
              success: function (res) {
                if (res.confirm) {//  applyUpdate 
                  updateManager.applyUpdate()
                }
              }
            })
          });
          updateManager.onUpdateFailed(function () {
            wx.showModal({// 
              title: '~',
              content: '~~',
            })
          })
        }
      })
    } else {
      wx.showModal({// 
        title: '',
        content: ''
      })
    }
  },

Post.title: 7ajax
Post._content:
## ajax ```js // ajax let data = { name: '', age: '12' } let url = './sendmsg' let xml = new XMLHttpRequest() xml.onreadystatechange = function(xhr) { if(xhr.readyState == 4) { // readyState0-->send 1-->send() 2-->send()3--> if(xhr.state == 200) { console.log(xhr.responseText) } } } // ``` promise ajax ```js // promise ajax function ajax(url,data){ return new Promise((res,rej)=>{ let xml = new XMLHttpRequest() xml.onreadystatechange = function(xhr){ if(xhr.readyState == 4) { if(xhr.state == 200) { res({url,data}) } else { rej() } } else { rej() } } xml.open('POST',url,true) xml.send(data) }) } ajax(url,data).then(({url,data})=>{ }) ``` #### ###### 1. ajax ###### 2. imglinkscript img link script cdncdn scriptjsonp ###### 3. jsonp **scriptjsonp**
http://localhost:8081http://localhost:8082 1js http://localhost:8082/index.jscallback ```js callback({ name: '', age: 12 }) ``` 2scriptindex ```js ``` callbackscriptwindow
3script ```js window.callback = function(data){ // datacallback { name: '', age: 12 } } ``` ###### 4. cors CORS header header ![](https://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/20892169-efbefcbd891c78b8.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/1240) ###### 5. ajax fetch() axios

Post.title: 4-3async await
Post._content:
<meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">



## generator
```javascript
function* generator(a) {
    yield console.log(a);
    let b = 111+222;
    yield a+b;
    let d = yield 765+3
    console.log(`d=${d}`)
    return 1234567
}
let gen = generator(333)
gen.next() // value:333,done:false,
gen.next() // value:666,done:false
gen.next() // value:768,done:false
gen.next(123) // d = 123 value:1234567(return1234567returnundefined),done:true
//next()yield
```
**1. for...ofgeneratoriteratornext()**
```javascript
function* foo() {
    yield 1;
    yield 2;
    yield 3;
    yield 4;
    yield 5;
}

for(let v of foo()) {
    console.log(v)
}
// 1 2 3 4 5 
```

**3. g.throw(err) generator**
**4. g.return() generator**
**5. yield\* gen() generatorgeneratoryield\***
**6. generatorgeneratoriterator**
```javascript
let obj = {
    fun:function() {

    },
    fun1: function* () {

    }
}
// 
let obj = {
    fun () {

    },
    *fun1 () {

    }
}
```

## asyncawait
** async async`promise`promise**
** await`promise.then()``promise`async**

#### 1. async/awaitPromiseasync
 async/awaitasync/awaitpromise
promise.then promise.catch
promisepromise.catchtry...catchasync/await
 ```javascript
async function fn1 () {
    let a = Promise.reject(100)
    // Uncaught (in promise) 100
    const res = await a 
// awaitpromise.then
// Promise.reject(100).then(()=>{})reject
    console.log(res)  
}
fn1() // Uncaught (in promise) 100
```

```javascript
async function fn1 () {
    let a = Promise.reject(100)
    // Uncaught (in promise) 100
    try{
        const res = await a // awaitpromise.thenreject
        console.log(res)  
    }
    catch(e) {
        console.log(`e=${e}`) // e=100
    }
}
fn1() // e=100
```

#### 2. asyncpromise.thenawaitpromise.then()
asyncreturn***then***
asyncasync Promise then
await promiseasync promise.then()
async  Promise **await Promise return****asyncthen**
```javascript
async function fn1 () {
    return 100 //  return Promise.resolve(100)
}
fn1 == 100 // falseasyncpromisepromise.resolve(100)
fn1().then((n)=>{ // asyncpromisethen
    console.log(`n=${n}`) // 100
})
```
#### 3. await Promise  Promise asyncreturnpromise
```javascript
async function fn1 () {
    let a = await 100 // await Promise  Promise 
   // a.then()
   // awaitpromisepromise
    console.log(a) // 100
}
```
```javascript
// awaitthen
async function fna() {
    let a = await Promise.resolve(100) 
// Promise.resolve(100).then()then
// then100a100
}
```

### 4. awaitpromiseasyncawait
```javascript
function timeout(ms) {
    return new Promise((resolve) => {
      console.log('resolve=',resolve)
      setTimeout(()=>{resolve(100)}, ms);
    });
  }
  
  async function asyncPrint(value, ms) {
    let a = await timeout(ms);
    console.log('a='+a)
    console.log(value);
  }  //a =100
```

###5. asynccatchpromise.catch()
```
async function fn1() {
    try {
        const p4 = Promise.reject('err1')
        const res = await p4
        console.log(res)
    }
    catch(err) {
        console.log(err)
    }
}
fn1() // err1
```
### awaitpromisereject
```javascript
async function fn1() {
    const p4 = Promise.reject('err1')
    const res = await p4
    console.log(res)
}
fn1() // Uncaught (in promise) err1
//  try catch
```

### 5.event-loop
async/awaitevent-loop
await event-loop
```javascript
async function fn1() {
    console.log(1)
    await console.log(2)

        await console.log(3)

            await setTimeout(()=>{console.log(4)},3000)
            console.log(5)

                await console.log(6)
                console.log(7)
}
fn1() 
console.log(8) // 1 2 8 3 5 6 7 4
// fn1() 
// console.log(1)
// console.log(2)
//  await ,await
// console.log(8)
// await

event.target.dataset.a == 1 event.currentTarget // event.target.matches(selector) --> // id ``` ##### xxx.addEventListener('xxx',function(){},true) true ## ## #### ```javascript function bindEvent(element,eventType,selector,fn) { if(fn == null) { // fn fn = selector selector = null } element.addEventListener(eventType,e => { let target = e.target if (selector) { if (target.matches(selector)) { fn.call(target,e) } } else { // // window.fn.call(target,e) callcallfntarget.fn fn.call(target,e) // callbindEventwindowthiswindowthisaddEventListenerevent } }) } ``` ```javascript // selector function bindEvent(element,eventType,fn,selector) { element.addEventListener(eventType,(event)=>{ let target = event.target if(selector) { if(target.matches(selector)) { fn.call(target,event) } } else { fn.call(target,event) } }) } let btn = document.querySelector('btn') bindEvent(btn,'click','child_div',function(e){ e.preventDefault() alert(this.innerHTML) }) ```

```javascript
function clone(target) {
    if(typeof target === 'object') {
        let cloneTarget = Array.isArray(target) ? [] : {}
        for(const key in target) {
            cloneTarget[key] = clone(target[key])
        }
        return cloneTarget
    } else {
        return target
    }
}
```

```javascript
function clone(target, map = new Map()) {
    if (typeof target === 'object') {
        let cloneTarget = Array.isArray(target) ? [] : {};
        if (map.get(target)) {
            // mapvalue
            return map.get(target);
        }
        map.set(target, cloneTarget);
        for (const key in target) {
            cloneTarget[key] = clone(target[key], map);
        }
        return cloneTarget;
    } else {
        return target;
    }
};
```
#### isEquals()
```javascript
// 5.2 isEquals()
function isObject(obj) {
  return typeof obj === "object" && obj !== null
}
function isEqual(obj1,obj2){
    if(!isObject(obj1) || !isObject(obj2)){
        return obj1 === obj2
    }
    if(obj1 === obj2) {
        return true
    }
    const obj1Keys = Object.keys(obj1).length
    const obj2Keys = Object.keys(obj2).length
    if (obj1Keys !== obj2Keys) {
        return false
    }
    for (let i in obj1) {
        const res = isEqual(obj1[i],obj2[i])
        if(!res) {
            return false
        }
    }
    return true
} 
```

#### callapplybind


callapplybindapplybindapply

bingthiscallapply
```javascript
let fullname = {
    getFullName (city,country) {
        return this.firstname+this.lastname+'from'+country+city
    }
}
let name = {
    firstname: 'bai',
    lastname:'xue'
}
```
###### bind
```javascript
let fullnamestring = fullname.getFullName.bind(name,'','')
fullnamestring() //'baixuefrom'
```
###### call
```javascript
let fullnamestring = fullname.getFullName.call(name,'','') //'baixuefrom'
```
###### apply
```javascript
let fullnamestring = fullname.getFullName.apply(name,['','']) //'baixuefrom'
```

}
A.prototype.aa = 'valueaa'
// 
B.__proto__ = A
B.prototype.__proto__ = A.prototype

let b = new B()
b.aa //valueaa
b.a // undefined
```
### inhasOwnproperty
keyhasOwnproperty

'aa' in b // truejavascript
b.hasOwnProperty('aa') // false

Post.title: h5
Post._content:
## APlayer HTML5 [](https://github.com/DIYgod/APlayer) ## npm: ```js npm install aplayer --save ``` Yarn: ```js yarn add aplayer ``` ## ```html
``` ```js const ap = new APlayer({ container: document.getElementById('aplayer'), audio: [{ name: 'name', artist: 'artist', url: 'url.mp3', cover: 'cover.jpg' }] }); ``` : ```js import 'APlayer/dist/APlayer.min.css'; import APlayer from 'APlayer'; const ap = new APlayer(options); ``` ##
container document.querySelector('.aplayer')
fixed false ,
mini false ,
autoplay false
theme '#b7daff'
loop 'all' , : 'all', 'one', 'none'
order 'list' , : 'list', 'random'
preload 'auto' : 'none', 'metadata', 'auto'
volume 0.7
audio - ,
audio.name -
audio.artist -
audio.url -
audio.cover -
audio.lrc -
audio.theme - theme
audio.type 'auto' : 'auto', 'hls', 'normal' ,
customAudioType -
mutex true
lrcType 0
listFolded false
listMaxHeight -
storageName 'aplayer-setting' localStorage key

``` Javascriptgitalk ```js const gitalk = new Gitalk({ clientID: 'GitHub Application Client ID', clientSecret: 'GitHub Application Client Secret', repo: 'GitHub repo', // The repository of store comments, owner: 'GitHub repo owner', admin: ['GitHub repo owner and collaborators, only these guys can initialize github issues'], id: location.pathname, // Ensure uniqueness and length less than 50 distractionFreeMode: false // Facebook-like distraction free mode }) gitalk.render('gitalk-container') ``` clientIDclientSecret ## * **ID**`String` ****GitHub ID * ****`String` ****GitHub * ****`String` ****GitHub * ****`String` ****GitHub * ****`Array` ****GitHub * **ID**`String` `location.href`. 50 * ****`Number` `-1`. issue ID`number`.issueissue`id` * ****`Array` `['Gitalk']`. GitHub * ****`String` `document.title`. GitHub * ****`String` `location.href + header.meta[description]`. GitHub * ****`String` `navigator.language || navigator.userLanguage`. [`en`,`zh-CN`,`zh-TW`,`es-ES`,`fr`,`ru`,`de`,`pl`,`ko`,`fa`,`ja`] * ****`Number` `10`. 100 * ****`Boolean` Facebook * **pagerDirection**`String` `last``first` * ****`Boolean` `false`. Gitalk github `admin` `true` * ****`String` `https://cors-anywhere.azm.workers.dev/https://github.com/login/oauth/access_token`. GitHub oauth CORS [](https://github.com/isaacs/github/issues/330) * ****`Object` ```source-js { staggerDelayBy: 150, appearAnimation: 'accordionVertical', enterAnimation: 'accordionVertical', leaveAnimation: 'accordionVertical', } ``` [](https://github.com/joshwcomeau/react-flip-move/blob/master/documentation/enter_leave_animations.md) * ****`Boolean` `true`. (cmd|ctrl + enter) ## [](https://bbdcsg.love/2019/12/11/cxy/other/gitalk/) ![](https://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/20892169-fa80cc39adc7320d.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/1240)

debounce

throttle

debounce

```js const debounce = (func, wait) => { let timer return () => { clearTimeout(timer) timer = setTimeout(func, wait); } } ```

```js function debounce(fn, delay = 500) { // timer let timer = null; return function() { if (timer) { clearTimeout(timer) } timer = setTimeout(() => { fn.apply(this, arguments) timer = null }, delay) } } // test debounce input1 = document.getElementById('input1') input1.addEventListener('keyup', debounce(function () { console.log(input1.value) }, 600)) ```

addEventListener debounce debounce

keydown timer null return timer delay keydown timer null...delay debounce keydown

throttle

```js const throttle = (func, wait) => { let timer; return () => { if (timer) { return } timer = setTimeout(() => { func(); timer = null }, wait) } } ```

```js function throttled(fn, delay = 500) { let timer = null return function (...args) { if (!timer) { timer = setTimeout(() => { fn.apply(this, args) timer = null }, delay); } } } // test let div1 = document.getElementById('div1') div1.addEventListener('drag', throttle(function(e) { console.log(e.offsetX, e.offsetY) }, 100)) ```

timer

  • setTimeout

  • clearTimout setTimeout
- > delay ```js function throttled1(fn, delay = 500) { let oldtime = Date.now() return function (...args) { let newtime = Date.now() if (newtime - oldtime >= delay) { fn.apply(null, args) oldtime = Date.now() } } } ```

  title: string;
  description: string;
}

type TODO2 = Partial<TODO>
let todo2: TODO2 = {
  title: 'sdfsdfsdf'
}
```
### 2. Required

```ts
interface Props {
  a?: number;
  b?: string;
}
const obj: Props = { a: 5 };
const obj2: Required<Props> = { a: 5 };
```
### 3. Readonly

```ts
interface Todo {
  title: string;
}

const todo: Readonly<Todo> = {
  title: "Delete inactive users",
};

todo.title = "Hello";
// TypeError: Cannot assign to 'title' because it is a read-only property.
```
### 4. Record<Keys, Type>
keyKeysvalueType
```ts
interface Employee {
  name: string;
  age: number;
}
let employee1: Record<number, Employee> = {
  0: { name: "zhao", age: 11111 },
  1: { name: "qian", age: 22222 },
  2: { name: "sun", age: 33333 },
  3: { name: "li", age: 44444 },
};
```
```ts
type Key = "zhaoID" | "qianID" | "sunID" | "liID";
let employee2: Record<Key, Employee> = {
  zhaoID: { name: "zhao", age: 11111 },
  qianID: { name: "qian", age: 22222 },
  sunID: { name: "sun", age: 33333 },
  liID: { name: "li", age: 44444 },
};
```
### 5. Pick<Type, Keys>
TypeKeys
### 6. Omit<Type, Keys>
TypeKeys
### 7. Exclude<UnionType, ExcludedMembers>
UnionTypeExcludedMembers
UnionTypeExcludedMembers****
### 8. Extract<Type, Union>
TypeUnion

## Vue3Vue2 + Vue32 + Typescript + ProxydefineProperty + domTree Shaking + Option apiComposition api + setup + refreactive + computedwatch + provideinject + + + Fragment + Teleport + Suspense + + api + api + ## ``` npm init vue ``` ``` npm create vite ``` ## Composition APIAPIOptions API #### 1. Composition API + + + ![option apicomposition api](https://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/20892169-a033ffcf9ab7f6a8.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/1240) composition api #### 2. + Options APICompositions API + Options APIComposition API + Compositon API HooksReact ## api ### 1. ref ref**** *ref reactive * ```js const aaa = ref({ name: { age: 12 }, age: 13333, items: [{ id:2, sex:'f' }] }) function changeName(){ aaa.value.items[0].id++ } ``` ```js ``` setupvaluevue ```js ``` ```js
{{ count }}
``` #### ref dom domref=xxx setup ```js let xxx = ref(null) ``` xxxdom ### 2. reactive reactive ```js const user = reactive({ name: "", age: 20, wife: { name: "", age: 21, cars: ["", "", ""], }, }); ``` ### 3reactiveref #### 3.1\. `ref` `reactive` [](https://so.csdn.net/so/search?q=%E6%95%B0%E7%BB%84&spm=1001.2101.3001.7020) #### 3.2. `ref` Class get set `reactive` Proxy Reflect #### 3.3. `ref` .value, .value `reactive` .value #### 3.4. reactiveref ref//reactive ### 5. setup #### 5.1. setup vue2beforeCreate setupthis #### 5.2. setup(props,context) `setup``props``props``props` `setup`contextcontext ```js { attrs, slots, emit, expose } ``` ```js setup(props, context) { // Attributes $attrs console.log(context.attrs) // $slots console.log(context.slots) // $emit console.log(context.emit) // console.log(context.expose) } ``` ```js setup(props,context) { ... } ``` ok definePropprops ```js import { defineEmits, defineProps } from "vue"; let props = defineProps<{ modelValue: string; }>(); let emit = defineEmits(); ``` ### 6. computed ```js ``` ### 7. watch watch deepimmediate ```js ``` ### 8. watchEffect #### flush `flush: 'post'` () `flush: 'sync'` **** ```js ``` #### + + + #### watchwatchEffect + watchwatchEffect + watchEffectwatch + watch + watch #### vue3 hooksvue2mixin vue3`hooks` js/tsuseMousePosition ```js import { onMounted, ref } from "vue"; export default function () { const x = ref(-1); const y = ref(-1); const clickHandler = (event: MouseEvent) => { x.value = event.pageX; y.value = event.pageY; }; onMounted(() => { window.addEventListener("mousemove", clickHandler); }); return { x, y }; } ``` vue ```js ``` ### 9. toRefs toRefs propertyref #### toRefs `reactive``...` `toRefs` `script setup`setup() ```js ``` ### 10. toRef() `toRef(obj,'propname')`reactiveRef ```js ``` ```js ``` ### 11. isRef() ref ```js let foo: unknown; if (isRef(foo)) { // foo Ref foo.value; } ``` ## api ### 1. shallowReactiveshallowRef `shallowReactive` `shallowRef` ShallowRef `shallowRef`Ref shallowRef ```js const state = shallowRef({ count: 1 }) // state.value.count = 2 // state.value = { count: 2 } ``` shallowReactive ```js const state = shallowReactive({ foo: 1, nested: { bar: 2 } }) // state.foo++ // ... isReactive(state.nested) // false // state.nested.bar++ ``` #### 2. triggerRef() [ ref](https://cn.vuejs.org/api/reactivity-advanced.html#shallowref) ```js function triggerRef(ref: ShallowRef): void const shallow = shallowRef({ greet: 'Hello, world' }) // "Hello, world" watchEffect(() => { console.log(shallow.value.greet) }) // ref shallow.value.greet = 'Hello, universe' // "Hello, universe" triggerRef(shallow) ``` #### 3. readonlyshallowReadonlyisReadonly `readonly()` () `ref` ##### readonly() ```js const original = reactive({ count: 0 }) const copy = readonly(original) watchEffect(() => { // console.log(copy.count) }) // original.count++ // copy.count++ // warning! ``` `shallowReadonly` `isReadonly` ##### shallowReadonly ```js const state = shallowReadonly({ foo: 1, nested: { bar: 2 } }) // state.foo++ // ... isReadonly(state.nested) // false // state.nested.bar++ ``` #### 4. toRaw() markRaw() toRaw ```js ``` markRaw ```js const foo = markRaw({}) console.log(isReactive(reactive(foo))) // false // const bar = reactive({ foo }) console.log(isReactive(bar.foo)) // false ``` #### 5. customRef() ref myRefcustomRef 2track,trgger() getsetget,set ```js function myRef(value){ return customRef((track,trigger)=>{ return { get(){ // track() return value; }, set(newValue){ value=newValue // trigger() } } }) } ``` ```js ``` ### 6. FragmentTeleport `Fragment`vue3 `Teleport`htmlbody ```js ``` body ### 7. Suspense suspense

Post._content:
## Object.defineProperty(obj, prop, descriptor) jsdefineProperty #### ```javascript var obj = new Object(); var value; Object.defineProperty(obj,'name',{ get: function () { console.log(`get${obj['name']} `); return value;//returnname }, set: function (newvalue) { console.log('set it'); value = newvalue;//value } }); console.log(obj); console.log(obj.name);//get it obj.name = aaaaa;//set it console.log(obj.name);//get it ``` #### vue2defineProperty htmldom ```javascript
``` ```javascript function observe(target) { if (typeof target !== "null" && typeof target !== "object") { return target; } for (let key in target) { defineReactive(target, key, target[key]); } } ``` ```javascript function defineReactive(target, key, value) { observe(value); // Object.defineProperty(target, key, { get() { return value; }, set(newValue) { if (value !== newValue) { value = newValue; updateView(JSON.stringify(target)); } else { console.log("value == newValue"); } } }); } ``` ```javascript function updateView(value) { document.querySelector(".wrapper").innerText = value; } let serveObj = { name: "aaaccc", age: 11, other: { sex: "f" } }; ``` ```javascript observe(serveObj); serveObj.name = "sdfdsfsdfsd" // dominnerHtml ``` ## proxy proxy #### ```javascript let obj = { a: 1 }; let proxy = new Proxy(obj, { get(target, key) { return target[key]; }, set(target, key, value, proxy) { target[key] = value; document.querySelector(".wrapper").innerText = JSON.stringify(proxy); } }); proxy.b = 1; obj // {a: 1, b: 1} ```

}

}

sass6

```css
$grid-width: 40px;
$gutter-width: 10px;

#sidebar { width: grid-width(5); }

from 1 through 3 1/2/3

```js
// 
var docEl = doc.documentElement;
// 
var resizeEvt = 'orientationchange' in window ? 'orientationchange' : 'resize';
//

    // 
    var clientWidth = docEl.clientWidth;
    if (!clientWidth) return;
    // 
    docEl.style.fontSize = 100 * (clientWidth / 750) + 'px';
  // 750pxok
};
// 
if (!doc.addEventListener) return;
win.addEventListener(resizeEvt, recalc, false);
// 
doc.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', recalc, false);
```

## umi+react

umiwebpackbabelReactumiWebpackumiWebpack Bundle Analyzer

Webpack Bundle Analyzer

```
npm install webpack-bundle-analyzer --save-dev
```
.umirc.jsWebpack Bundle Analyzer

```js
export default {
  plugins: [
    ['umi-plugin-react', {
      // Webpack Bundle Analyzer
      webpackBundleAnalyzer: {
        analyzerMode: 'server', // 
        analyzerHost: '127.0.0.1', // IP
        analyzerPort: 8888, // 
        openAnalyzer: true // 
      }
    }],
  ]
}

```

## 

A handsome and strong soldier wearing green military uniform, with half of his face visible, in a Japanese anime style. The illustration is semi-thickly painted with bright and colorful tones, resulting in an attractive and glossy finish. 

adg

The scene is set during daytime, under the shining sun. A sweet-looking Japanese-style girl is depicted from the waist up, sporting double buns with her hair mostly blue but also featuring some colorful strands. Her blue eyes are accentuated by a semi-thick paint style and the lighting is coming from the side, highlighting her slightly tilted head and resulting in an attractive glossy finish. 

3d
3d art c4d ultra detoiled

(Model Version 5)** | | --ar | --c | --q | --c | --stop | --stylize | | :----: | :--: | :---: | :----------: | :----------: | :----: | :-------: | | | 1:1 | 0 | 1 | | 100 | 100 | | | any | 0100 | .25 .5, or 1 | 04294967295 | 10100 | 01000 | - 2:1 ## `--seed` ### 1. `--seed` Midjourney MJ Seed MJ --seed **v4** SeedMidjourneySeed a rabbit --seed 4100004954seed ### 2. `--seed` - ![](/images/image-20230414155204499.png) Discord - Preferences - - ![](/images/image-20230414155237311.png) ![](/images/image-20230414155338981.png) ### 3. `seed``seed`12345`seed``12345` ![](/images/image-20230423181147356.png) 2`U2` ![](/images/image-20230423182136592.png) seed ![](/images/image-20230424102129976.png) seed ![](/images/image-20230424102243529.png) ![](/images/image-20230424102616997.png) **seed** ## `--chaos``--c` #### `--chaos``--chaos``--chaos` > `--chaos` 0100 > `--chaos` 0 chaos chaos ![](/images/image-20230424112750753.png) ![](/images/image-20230424112851699.png) ## `--remix` #### remixRemix `Remix` `/prefer remix` ![](/images/image-20230424120625511.png) `Make Variations``Remix`remix ![](/images/image-20230424120842336.png) chinese girl cat ![](/images/image-20230424120926944.png) ![](/images/image-20230424121226422.png) ## `upscaler` ### 1. #### Midjourney Midjourney upscaler

U1 U2 U3 U4
